solely due to my own efforts
autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the blessings in my life, forgetting to acknowledge them as gifts from God rather than solely due to my own efforts?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I felt envy towards others' blessings, wishing they would lose them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and use words that were vulgar or hurtful to others?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially when it comes to sweets or rich foods that can lead me away from a balanced and temperate lifestyle?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking, perhaps when dining out or entertaining at home, beyond what is reasonable for my body's needs?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable
gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable, thereby demonstrating an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejecting the call to temperance?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

in conversations at social events or through digital means

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true, while engaging in conversations at social events or through digital means?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did you engage in work on a Sunday when it otherwise could have been avoided, possibly out of habit or lack of planning?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

impiety.question: Did you engage in physical activity on Sunday, a day reserved for rest and prayer?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

anger.question: Have I nursed anger in my heart, allowing it to simmer rather than seeking reconciliation with others?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
